intro: Ruellia commutata, commonly known as the Mexican bluebell, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of the southern United States. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of blue or violet tubular flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shaded areas. Ruellia commutata is valued in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
